pages.title: The Artist
pages.quote:
The role of the artist is to make
the revolution irresistible.
pages.oneTitle:
The Artist loves exploring new
ideas and following their passions
to unexpected places.
pages.oneP: You’re probably no stranger to letting your curiosity guide you down many rabbit holes—whether it’s a niche new hobby or an internet quiz about what climate archetype you are.
pages.twoTitle: The Artist’s strength lies in communicating emotions and abstract concepts.
pages.twoP: You know when a piece of art just gets you? Like when a movie or a song perfectly captures your feelings on something? Of course you have. And luckily, that’s what you do best. Your ability to approach issues empathetically allows you to really get to the bottom of what people are feeling—and express those feelings with clarity and grace.
pages.threeTitle: The Artist often finds themselves fretting over details that others see as small or insignificant.
pages.threeP: Be honest: You’ve been called a perfectionist. Probably many times. But that might not exactly be accurate. You understand that the tiniest details could make or break a project. More importantly, you understand which tiny details actually matter. What you’re after isn’t perfection—it’s heart.
pages.fourTitle: The Artist believes in creativity as a powerful tool for changemaking.
pages.fourP: You have a unique ability to make people feel heard and seen. And that’s the first step in making someone feel empowered. Whether or not you’re an artist in the conventional sense, you can best support the fight against climate change by mobilizing, educating, and inspiring those around you. Check out the resources below to find out how The Artist champions climate action.
pages.inActionBlurb:
We met with dozens of young leaders across the country to explore the different ways you can
take action against climate change. Here are some of their stories.

pages.title: The Storyteller
pages.quote: For The Storyteller, the only thing more satisfying than hearing a good story is telling one.
pages.oneTitle: For The Storyteller, the only thing more satisfying than hearing a good story is telling one.
pages.oneP: At this point, telling stories is probably second nature to you. But it’s also your superpower.
pages.twoTitle: The Storyteller is the perfect mouthpiece for complex ideas.
pages.twoP: Admit it: You get a little frustrated when someone butchers a good story or makes something simple seem convoluted. But that’s because you’re uniquely capable of breaking down big ideas and presenting them in a way that is both compelling and easy to digest. So, for an issue as complicated and intimidating as climate change, we wouldn’t want anyone else on the job.
pages.threeTitle: The Storyteller finds themselves overwhelmed by injustices in the world.
pages.threeP: But let’s be clear: Your sensitivity is not a weakness. It’s your compass, and it’s your engine. Embrace it. It’s the very thing that drives you to explore difficult topics and make sense of them—for yourself and for those around you.
pages.fourTitle: The Storyteller believes that stories are what move people.
pages.fourP: Chances are, stories are what piqued your interest in climate action in the first place. Now, stories are going to be your most powerful tool in inspiring, educating, and driving the movement forward. Check out the resources below to find out how The Storyteller champions climate action.
pages.inActionBlurb:
We met with dozens of young leaders across the country to explore the different ways you can
take action against climate change. Here are some of their stories.
pages.careers: Climate Journalist • Documentary Filmmaker • Influencer • Climate Fiction Author

pages.title: The Caregiver
pages.quote: The greatness of a community is most accurately measured by the compassionate actions of its members.
pages.oneTitle: The Caregiver finds a deep sense of happiness in helping and supporting others.
pages.oneP: You never ignore a call for help. Whether it’s a friend, a family member, or even a complete stranger, you feel a strong sense of responsibility for the people around you. So, is it any wonder that you’re looking to participate in the climate movement?
pages.twoTitle: The Caregiver is uniquely capable of guiding their peers and their community towards shared objectives.
pages.twoP: Simply put, you lift people up. And sure, you might lean towards introversion, but you’re still a social person. In fact, the relationships you foster are as deep as they get—just ask some of your closest friends.
pages.threeTitle: The Caregiver finds themselves more comfortable in structured environments.
pages.threeP: This doesn’t mean that you’re rigid or inflexible, though. As a matter of fact, you are able to establish a feeling of structure and security where none previously existed. Or, in other words, you make the world a more comfortable and hospitable place for your peers.
pages.fourTitle: The Caregiver is the beating heart of any social movement.
pages.fourP: Your warmth, supportiveness, devotion, and attention to detail make you an invaluable asset to the climate movement. And a community without people like you is not a community at all. Check out the resources below to find out how The Caregiver champions climate action.
pages.inActionBlurb:
We met with dozens of young leaders across the country to explore the different ways you can
take action against climate change. Here are some of their stories.
pages.careers: Educator • Disaster Relief Worker • International Aid/Development Officer Conservationist • Advocate

pages.title: The Organizer
pages.quote: There is no power for change greater than a community discovering what it cares about.
pages.oneTitle: The Organizer finds immense joy in bringing people together, especially for a good cause.
pages.oneP: You’re outgoing, vibrant, and socially adept—but you already knew that. At parties, you tend to be the one introducing people to one another. Chances are, you’re the one who planned the party in the first place.
pages.twoTitle: The Organizer is uniquely capable of building strong coalitions.
pages.twoP: Look, none of us can fix climate change on our own—climate action is a team sport. Luckily, no one can put together a team quite like you can.
pages.threeTitle: The Organizer sometimes finds themselves feeling scattered.
pages.threeP: But it actually stems from one of your greatest strengths: your flexibility and adaptability. You can go from serious to playful at the snap of a finger, and you know exactly how to make just about anyone feel comfortable, seen, and appreciated.
pages.fourTitle: Movements don’t exist without people like The Organizer.
pages.fourP: You can really make a difference by helping to grow, mobilize, and of course, organize the climate movement ecosystem. You’re naturally charismatic and have a knack for leadership—just don’t let it get to your head. Check out the resources below to find out how The Organizer champions climate action.
pages.inActionBlurb:
We met with dozens of young leaders across the country to explore the different ways you can
take action against climate change. Here are some of their stories.
pages.careers: Advocacy Professional • Union Representative • Movement Founder March Leader • Politician

pages.title: The Architect
pages.quote: Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.
pages.oneTitle: The Architect enjoys immersing themselves in complex systems and ideas.
pages.oneP: You have an analytical, rational nature, but you are anything but rigid. You’re more of a tinkerer, always eager to get hands-on with the systems and ideas that fascinate you. And when something fascinates you, you’re "reading-obscure- articles-on-Wikipidia-at-2-in-the-morning" levels of hooked.
pages.twoTitle: You can always count on The Architect to come up with a plan.
pages.twoP: The way you think is particularly well-suited for coming up with strategies. Big picture, little picture—you can see it all. But the bottom line is you’re a pretty smart cookie.
pages.threeTitle: The Architect is fiercely ambitious and likes to shoot for the stars.
pages.threeP: Some people might call you an idealist. And you’d probably call them buzzkills. More often than not, you’re usually able to see your ambitions through and succeed, despite your lofty goals.
pages.fourTitle: The Architect stands out as the originator of big and exciting ideas.
pages.fourP: When it comes to climate action, there’s literally no time for pessimism. Whether you’re designing systems or inventing gadgets, you can be a powerful ally—and source of inspiration—to those in the climate movement ecosystem. Check out the resources below to find out how The Architect champions climate action.
pages.inActionBlurb:
We met with dozens of young leaders across the country to explore the different ways you can
take action against climate change. Here are some of their stories.
pages.careers: Climate Tech Founder • Strategist • Convenor • Environmental Lawyer • Green Asset Manager Policy Analyst • Energy Sector Executive • Politician

pages.title: The Scientist
pages.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
pages.oneTitle: The Scientist finds great satisfaction in coming up with definitive answers to complex problems.
pages.oneP: You are curious. It’s really as simple as that. You find the unknown irresistible and pursue knowledge with fervour—because you kinda can’t help yourself.
pages.twoTitle: The Scientist’s methodical approach always yields valuable information.
pages.twoP: When you are unsure of something, you either do the research or put it to the test. And if you come back with unexpected results, you are guaranteed to have learned something valuable along the way.
pages.threeTitle: The Scientist can become quite single-minded in their pursuits.
pages.threeP: Your dedication and focus, however, is anything but narrow-mindedness. You welcome and embrace new people and novel sources of information, even when they challenge your preconceived notions. In fact, that’s probably your favourite part.
pages.fourTitle: The Scientist provides the backbone of the climate movement.
pages.fourP: And we’re not just talking about “scientists” in the institutional sense. Anyone from a researcher to a traditional knowledge keeper fits the bill. Because ultimately, it’s people like you who are figuring out what’s happening and proposing solutions. Check out the resources below to find out how The Scientist champions climate action.
pages.inActionBlurb:
We met with dozens of young leaders across the country to explore the different ways you can
take action against climate change. Here are some of their stories.
pages.careers: Researcher • Start-up Founder • Climate Science Journalist Science Communicator • Energy Industry Process Engineer

pages.title: The Entrepreneur
pages.quote: Human creativity is unlimited. It is the capacity of humans to make things happen which didn’t happen before. Creativity provides the key to solving our social and economic problems.
pages.oneTitle: The Entrepreneur finds joy in uncovering opportunities and taking risks.
pages.oneP: Let me paint you your nightmare scenario: Sitting in a boring office, working a monotonous job for hours and hours and hours on end. Terrified yet? For you, taking risks isn’t scary—the thought of letting great opportunities pass you by is.
pages.twoTitle: The Entrepreneur is uniquely capable of pinpointing needs.
pages.twoP: You’re a quick learner and an even quicker doer. When faced with a challenge, you take it on with confidence—or delegate the perfect people to do it instead.
pages.threeTitle: The Entrepreneur often acts before they think.
pages.threeP: You can probably think of a couple times when your risk-taking tendencies have landed you in hot water. But, more often than not, it’s precisely your initiative that gives you an advantage in your endeavours. And who’s afraid of a little hot water?
pages.fourTitle: The Entrepreneur can help imagine a more sustainable and prosperous world.
pages.fourP: A wildly creative mind paired with a can-do attitude equals the ideal person for identifying the countless opportunities for improvement in our world that have been revealed by the climate crisis. By all means, let’s tear down the problematic parts of our current systems—but people like you are going to come up with the things that will take their place. Check out the resources below to find out how The Entrepreneur champions climate action.
pages.inActionBlurb:
We met with dozens of young leaders across the country to explore the different ways you can
take action against climate change. Here are some of their stories.
pages.careers: Non-Profit Director • Start-up/Social Enterprise Founder • Program Designer • Politician

pages.title: The Reformer
pages.quote: Oftentimes the most righteous thing you can do is shake the table.
pages.oneTitle: The Reformer derives a great deal of satisfaction from making things more efficient and equitable.
pages.oneP: It’s easy to get discouraged by the inefficiencies and injustices that define many of our current political, social, and economic systems. But for you, they’re just a signal that there’s a lot of work to be done. You’re probably already rolling up your sleeves and raring to go—after all, that envelope isn’t going to push itself.
pages.twoTitle: The Reformer is uniquely capable of enacting real, meaningful change in our systems.
pages.twoP: Progress may be incremental, but progress is progress. Your combination of analytical thinking and passion for doing the right thing makes you incredibly capable of innovating within existing power structures and pushing for tangible change.
pages.threeTitle: The Reformer’s reverence for structure may feel restricting to some people.
pages.threeP: Does the status quo suck sometimes? Yes, of course. But you’re not interested in throwing the baby out with the bathwater. You just want to identify what works and what doesn’t—and there’s real value in that.
pages.fourTitle: The Reformer can help us define what we are fighting for.
pages.fourP: When it comes to the climate crisis, it’s clear that our systems are failing us. But if you can imagine a better world for us, it might just become a blueprint for our future. Check out the resources below to find out how The Reformer champions climate action.
